data.scheme_name: Scheme of Assistance to MSEs for Shed developed by Private Developer -Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides assistance up to 55% of the total cost of land, building, infrastructure, and consultancy fees, maximum of Rs. 500 lakhs.
data.eligibility:
All Mini Estate developer industries intending to develop mini estate shall be eligible to avail benefits under this scheme. Following Expenses shall be considered as per project cost- 

- Land Cost: Based on the area's jantri price or the actual price paid, whichever is lower. 

- Building Cost: Decided by State Level Empowered Committee as per the prevailing Schedule of Rates of the relevant government department. 

- Infrastructure Cost: Determined by State Level Empowered Committee as per the prevailing Schedule of Rates of the relevant government department. 

- Consultancy Fees: Up to 3% of the project cost or Rs. 20 lakhs, whichever is less.
data.conditions:
Conditions of the scheme are listed below: 

- Shed size: 50-100 sq. meters; mini estate: max 2 hectares. 

- Land must be developer

-owned, in an industrial zone, and converted to industrial use if needed. 

- Mini Estate registration is required before project initiation. 

- Projects started before registration are ineligible for assistance. 

- Developer must secure all necessary approvals and permissions.

- Approved infrastructure must be developed within two years.

 - "Plug and play" infrastructure must be provided. 

- Developer maintains the project for five years, then transfers maintenance to an estate members' association. 

- Only user charges (no additional fees) are allowed for facilities, in agreement with shed holders. 

- Only approved service activities are eligible; trading is excluded. 

- Developer must appoint a TPQA agency from an approved list and submit inspection reports. 

- MSME Commissionerate issues forms, checklists, and guidelines.

 - Allotment price of sheds cannot be increased for three years post-first sale. 

- Only one shed can be sold per MSE; unsold sheds may be sold after three years.

- If infrastructure is not developed as approved, assistance may be reclaimed as arrears.

 - Assistance is disbursed based on government grant availability.
data.beneficiaries: All Mini Estate developer industries intending to develop mini estate shall be eligible to avail benefits under this scheme

data.context:
The main purpose of this scheme is to MSEs have very limited financial resources and find difficulties to start this units in development industrial areas.
In this context, existing incentive schemes were reviewed, and necessary suggestions have been incorporated in the Gujarat Industrial Policy 2020.
data.objective: The main objective of this scheme is to promote and encourage Mini Estate by Private Institutions which aim at upgrading and improving state infrastructure and to boost economic activity and employment generation.
data.description: Scheme provides assistance up to 55% of the total cost of land, building, infrastructure, and consultancy fees, maximum of Rs. 500 lakhs.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply from this site Industrial Policy 2020 | MSME Gujarat
data.funding_mechanism:
1. Initial Disbursement (30%): 30% of the total shed cost is disbursed to the private developer after each individual shed is sold. 

2. Final Disbursement (25%): The remaining 25% of the assistance is released once the MSEs commence production in the sheds. 

3. Transfer of Assistance: The private developer must pass on the full assistance amount to the allottee at the time of allotment.
data.additional_info:
Cost of Shed: This includes the total cost of land (with stamp duty and registration), building costs, infrastructure facilities as per government rates, and fees for technical consultancy and quality assessment. 

Infrastructure Facilities means minimum facilities required to be provided by the Private Developer to set up Mini Estate for MSEs mentioned below and as approved by SLEC.

 1. Asphalt Road /RCC Road/ Cement Concrete Road. 

2. Storm Water Drainage System. 

3. Domestic Sewerage Collection and Disposal System. 

4. Streetlights. 

5. Water/Gas/Power Supply distribution network up to the shed. 

6. Steam / Gas pipeline. 

7. Connectivity for communication.

 

 The private developer will pass on this assistance to the allotee at the time of allotment.

  •  List of ineligible expenditures include: Land development, Goodwill fees, Commissioning fees, Royalty, Preliminary and pre-operative expenses, Capitalized interest, Transportation equipment/vehicles, Non-technical consultancy fees, Working capital and Any other expenses not specified as eligible investments

Address : Office of the MSME Coommissionerate, Block No. 1, 4th Floor, Udyog Bhavan, Gandhinagar 382 010. Gujarat. INDIA
Email id : https://msmec.gujarat.gov.in
